Content:

Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> this is not technically accurate, it is hype stuff. be careful

Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> just because you use magical words, doesnt make it real

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> it appears to be a custodial contract that creates onchain tokens and another contract that manages the balances. this is not any cross chain atomic swap

Content: [dscrd-hush] <BaBa WhiteSheep> @dukeleto Will future Silent Dragon be able to provide such services? BlackHole File Transfer: Blockchain-based file transfer. Designed for everyday use. via @ProductHunt https://www.producthunt.com/posts/blackhole-file-transfer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <AkiraX> !mining

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @AkiraX i bought some A9's, you got me jealous

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @BaBa WhiteSheep SD will support file upload and thanks for that link, haven't seen that before

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Amazingly it's written in Pascal: https://github.com/blackholeorganization/BlackHoleProtocol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that was actually the first language I ever really learned, and it's not common to see these days

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> unclear how it actually uses the blockchain, it's not using Zcash protocol that I can see

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's interesting to see competitors in the space, that means there is a market that wants solutions to these kinds of problems

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @BaBa WhiteSheep Hush will be optimized for sharing small and medium sized files, and it will be purposefully expensive to store very large files, because that can be used as an attack method. For large files, we can store IPFS or bittorrent URLs inside of encrypted memo fields.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the size of small/medium/large has not been finalized, but small means "less than 200KB" and medium means "less than 4MB"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> for now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> images and PDFs and files you would email, that is what Hush will be optimized for

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> 4MB for say a Will document in the form of PDF should be enough. There will be exceptions though.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 4MB is our block size

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we can store more than 1 block worth, we can store larger files

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but at some point, if you want to upload a 2GB file every day or something like that, you use up all transaction space

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> very similar to the Sapling Woodchipper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is not BitTorrent

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> block space is precious, but we want people to store reasonable sized files and then references to larger files

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't want your 10GB of porn on the Hush blockchain, no matter how curated and hi-def it is

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> üò∫

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 20MB or 40MB might be a reasonable limit to prevent abuse. we need to find what works

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Other than UHD video, what kind of messages would people be sending that would take up gigabytes? lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zcash param files üòÉ
